commit_message: Updated hicAssemblerNotebook.ipynb so that it leverages the various .py modules written. Makes the notebook way easier follow as the entire code base is no longer contained within the notebook

Update README.md

Added a recommendation for removing small scale scaffolds prior to ICE normalization to improve assembly results

Fixed potential bug in orderGenome.py function where small scaffolds with zero contacts between them create an adjacency matrix that sums to zero for a particular chromosome. This caused the cost function to produce a division by zero erro. An arbitrary order and orientation is now returned if this happens. Shouldn't occur in general as long as small scale scaffolds < 10Kb in size are removed prior to ICE normalization. Could also occur if the chromosome grouping algorithm fails to produce meaningful chromosome groups, but that would be a different issue altogether and the beginning of the pipeline should be rerun with diffent settings.
changed wording of documentation for png vs pdf
fixed example output in fasta writing sectin to reflect the 500kb version of the inornatus genome
applied fixes to jupyter notebook version
Provided new file with install instructions and deleted old one
New package installation commands and instructions
New file with package installation instructions

better fix for plotting array instead of matrix

- Changed the log statements and ordering of the array check for plotting to be more verbose / robust to error

bug fixes for runHicAssembler and plotting module

- Fixed invalid warning in runHicAssembler for hmm lookAhead option
- Fixed bug in plotContactMaps where the matrix formatting was invalid with some configurations of numpy + numba. Briefly, the numpy.percentile function does not like matrix format but rather array format

fixed typo in readme

Fixed typo in part1 parameter descriptions. hmm is allowed to be a value between 0-1 (NOT 0-100)

- Implemented new heirarchical clustering tree cutting algorithm to group bins into chromosome sized groups. Breifly, the algorithm attempts to find the optimal grouping of a clustered square matrix by comparing to the rank ordered matrix via iterative hyper geometric tests by sliding 1 row by 1 column at a time, and calculating how many rank ordered indices are within the current window. Each time a significant jump in pvalues occurs (0.--> 1.) essentailly, we catalogue the break point and restart the algorithm with adjusted world size and resetting the local window size to zero. A noisy cut algorithm is then run to identify cuts that were too aggressive via another round of hyper geometric tests, but this time essentially comparing adjacent cut groups to one another for significant rankordered matrix overlap and removing cut if necessary. Algorithm then runs until convergence.
- hyperGeom option is now the default option for cluster grouping - Changed default min_size argument from 20 --> 5
- Changed default hmm convergenceRounds from 8 --> 5
- Added lookAhead option for hmm. Default value is .2
- Added psig option for hyper geometric. Default value is .05
- Updated hicAssembler_config.txt with relevant information about new options
- Updated hicAssembler_config_workingExample.txt with relevant information about new otptions
- Updated run_hicAssembler with new defaults and documentation, and pipeline updates for hyper geom or hmm options
- Modularity can be used for the whole dataset if set to 1 (uses the log10 transform of the data which is easy to change within the code if desired)
- Fixed a bug where modularity results might not be reported properly if the avg clustering results didn't match the modularity groupings
- Fixed a bug at the very end of the pipeline in the writeScaffoldOrderingsToFile function where a list value was expected instead of a RestrictionScaffold object. Can handle both now
Original code base and jupyter notebook used for chromosome level scaffolding of the marmoratus and inornatus genomes utilizing HiC data and already established primary assemblies
